ext_description.p: A Product is the identification of a product or of a type of product. It is a collector of data common to all revisions of the Product.

note.p: Products that this entity data type can represent, include:

ul.li: products existing in the real world;
products that may come into existence as a consequence of some realization process. This includes parts and documents;

ext_description.example: The SS Titanic is a product that could be represented by the entity data type Product.
Lifeboat is a class of products that could be represented by the entity data type Product. Each lifeboat on the SS Titanic is a member of this class.
ext_description.note: A product is identified by an organization or a person in an organization. The definition of the domain of uniqueness and the mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of product id are outside the scope of this application module.
A product may have zero or more versions. A version of a product is represented with an instance of the entity Product_version or of one of its specializations.

ext_description.p: the identifier that distinguishes the product.
ext_description.note: A particular codification for the values of this attribute may be specified in the EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

example.p: Part numbers, stock item numbers, and serial numbers are examples of product identifiers.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the product is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Product. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
id and name shall not be both no-word strings.
